intro: Elatostema tetracephalum, commonly known as the four-headed elatostema, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Elatostema tetracephalum is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens.
